title.narrative: Inception phase Tax Reform II Moldova

description.narrative:
Insatsen syftar till att finansiera framtagandet av ett väl genomarbetat programförslag för en andra fas av samarbetet (twinning) mellan det svenska skatteverket och den moldaviska skattemyndigheten i att reformera skattesystemet i landet.
Skatteverket inkom i september 2017 med ett utkast till projektförslag. Efter gransking av ambassaden och dess kvalitetssäkringskommitté ombads Skatteverket att förbättra kvalitén på förslaget (se bilaga 3 ’Notes from QAC’ och 4 ’Letter to Skatteverket with recommendations of amendments’). Efter en rad förhandlingar så bedömde ambassaden och Skatteverket att den bästa lösningen var att först genomföra en förberedande fas där Skatteverket tillsammans med sin Moldaviska partner tar fram ett väl genomarbetat förslag till programmet.

The aim of the contribution is to finance the preparation of good quality programme proposal for a second phase of the collaboration (twinning) between the Swedish Tax Agency and the Moldovan Tax Service to reform the taxation system in the country.
In September 2017, the Swedish Tax Agency (STA) submitted a draft project proposal. The Embassy and its Quality Assurance Committee reviewed the proposal and recommended a set of amendments (Se Annex 3 ‘Notes from QAC’ and 4 ‘’Letter to Skatteverket with recommendations of amendments’). Following a series of negotiation it was agreed jointly by the Embassy and the STA to first implement an inception phase through which the STA together with its Moldovan counterpart should prepare a good quality proposal for the implementation of the programme.

The purpose of the Inception phase was to conduct preparatory work and missions to Moldova, in order to complete the proposal for a second phase of the collaboration between the Swedish Tax Agency and the Moldovan State Tax Service.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Inception phase resulted in a well designed Project proposal for the implementation of a second phase of collaboration between the parties, the Swedish Tax Service (STA) and the Moldovan State Tax Service (STS). During the inception phase, STA had a Long Term Expert (LTE) stationed in Moldova. This ensured a continuous and effective dialogue with STA as well as with the STS experts that took part in the preparations through short-term missions. The teams from STA and STS collected facts and jointly defined the scope of the three components expected to be included in the project. Efforts were made to assure that all the strategic departments within STA and STS, that were supposed to collaborate, agreed on the content. Further, that the activities to be included in the three components were deemed realistic to achieve and that they reflected the priorities of STS. During the Inception phase, the format of cooperation between LTE and STS were defined and key staff that would lead the process on behalf of STS were appointed. The set up was was well communicated internally within STA and STS which in turn led to a straight forward decision making process well in advance before the Inception phase ended. The expected results were achieved and the products according to the agreement delivered: - A Progress report describing the findings and conclusions derived from the preparatory missions, - A final Project proposal including budget and work plan for the second phase of collaboration between STS and STA, - A draft agreement between STS and STA on the content, scope and collaboration methods for the second phase of collaboration, - A Final Report of the Inception phase was submitted to Sida.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
